Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In June or July of 2024, youth was being sexually assaulted at the
facility. Currently, youth continues to be sexually assaulted by
their roommate and other youth at the facility.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was not interviewed. Messages were left on
09/12/2024 and 09/24/2024 and a return call was not received.
Youth A was interviewed in person on 09/13/2024 at Wolverine
Center by another Department of Health and Human Service
(DHHS) worker, while I interviewed Youth A at the same time by
phone. Youth A confirmed the allegation of sexual assault in
06/2024 or 07/2024 was at Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s
former location (CE820414010), which was already investigated in
SI2024SIC0001495 with no findings. Youth A stated his current
allegation occurred at Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s current
location (CE820414010) on Unit 2D when he was there from
08/27/2024 to 09/12/2024. Youth A stated Youth B sexually
harassed him and provided the following examples. In the first
example, Youth B asked Youth A to sit with him at a table. Youth
B told Youth A that he would “suck his dick”. Youth A stated he
refused to sit with Youth B. In the second example, Youth B took
off his clothes and exposed his genitals in the common area of the
unit on 09/12/2024. Youth A stated Youth C and Youth D also
witnessed this incident. Youth A stated Staff 1 redirected Youth B
to go to his room to put on clothes. Youth A stated staff redirect
Youth B, but Youth B does not comply with the redirections. Youth
A stated he wrote a grievance about Youth B’s sexual acting out. I
attempted to make face to face contact with Youth A on
09/20/2024 at his current placement, Wolverine Center, but Youth
A was at a crisis center for evaluation.

Youth B stated staff verbally redirect him with boundary issues.
Youth C was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne County

when asked if Youth B had boundary issues with other youths.
Youth C stated staff intervene and redirect Youth B’s boundary

Youth D was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne County

Youth E was interviewed on 10/11/2024 by phone. Youth E was

Youth B stood over Youth E when Youth E was seated watching

Youth E stated this type of incident was not uncommon and staff

Staff 1 did not recall Youth B trying to touch Youth A or Youth E.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 10/02/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile

Supervisor was interviewed on 09/23/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with another DHHS worker. Supervisor stated

one staff to one youth ratio to assist with his boundary issues.
Documentation
Youth B’s sexual incident reports were requested for review.
There are no incident reports about Youth B taking off his clothes
on Unit 2D. There is one incident report dated 09/01/2024 written
by Staff 1. It states Youth B brushed up on Youth C and Youth C
hit Youth B. It states the incident was processed and ended with
apologies and a handshake.
Video
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Special Investigation Unit
Investigator 1 stated there are no video footages of Youth B
hugging or touching youths on 08/28/2024 or 08/29/2024. These
dates are based on the grievances filed by Youth A. There is no
video footage on 09/12/2024 of Youth B lifting up his long shirt
and exposing himself. This date is based on Youth A’s interview.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance in working with Youth B’s
boundary issues and providing for the needs, protection and
supervision of the youths on the unit. Interviews support staff
provide redirection and intervention as needed with Youth B’s
boundary issues.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED

Youth A wrote a grievance dated 08/29/2024. Youth A wrote he
wanted Youth B moved off Unit 2D and charges pressed on Youth
B for sexual harassment towards Youth A and Unit 2D youths.
Youth A received a grievance resolution letter on 08/29/2024. It
states Youth A’s grievance was forwarded to the Wayne County
Sheriff Office (Special Investigation Unit) for investigation and the
grievance was resolved.
Youth A wrote a grievance dated 08/29/2024 on behalf of Youth E.
Youth A wrote Youth B makes sexual advances towards Youth A,
Youth E and other youths. Youth A wrote that Youth B talked
sexually and hugged Youth A and touched his buttocks the day
before and grabbed and squeezed Youth E’s buttocks on
08/29/2024. Youth A wrote Youth B should be moved off the unit
and charges pressed on Youth B. Youth A received a grievance
resolution letter on 08/30/2024. It states Youth A’s grievance was
forwarded to Wayne County Sheriff Office (Special Investigation
Unit) for investigation and the grievance was resolved.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Special Investigation Unit
Investigator 2 emailed Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Quality
Assurance Supervisor and other facility personnel on 09/16/2024.
Investigator 2 wrote that around 09/04/2024 Youth A wrote a
grievance. Investigator 2 interviewed Youth A and determined that
Youth A wrote the grievance on behalf of Youth E. Investigator 2
wrote that the allegation is under investigation.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance when providing Youth A
grievance letters stating the grievances were resolved. Forwarding
a youth’s grievance to the Special Investigation Unit can be part of
the action towards resolution, but does not speak to the immediate
needs of the situation and the final resolution of the grievance.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

sir_summary.summary: The investigation involved allegations that a youth (Youth B) sexually harassed and assaulted other residents at the Wayne County Juvenile Detention Center. While the primary allegation of insufficient staff to protect residents was not substantiated, as staff were found to be actively redirecting and supervising Youth B (including using a 1:1 ratio), a procedural violation was substantiated. The facility failed to properly resolve grievances, issuing letters stating grievances were 'resolved' merely because they were forwarded to a sheriff's unit for investigation, without addressing the immediate safety concerns or final outcome. The facility is culpable for this administrative failure in its grievance process.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violation is a failure to provide a written copy of the grievance resolution. The grievance itself pertained to Youth B's repeated sexual harassment, which included sexual comments, unwanted touching (e.g., hugging, touching buttocks), and exposing genitals to other youth. While the initial allegation of sexual assault was not substantiated, the underlying incidents prompting the grievance constitute youth-on-youth violence (sexual harassment and inappropriate physical contact) and raise serious safety risks. The facility's failure to properly resolve and document the outcome of this safety-related grievance aligns with the 'Severe' category for 'Safety and Violence'.
